content.title: Neurogenic TOS Detailed
content.description: Detailed evaluation and management of neurogenic thoracic outlet syndrome

key_concepts.details: Upper extremity pain, paresthesias, weakness; typically ulnar distribution
Most common; symptoms without objective neurologic findings
Rare; objective atrophy/weakness, often lower trunk involvement (Gilliatt-Sumner hand)
Physical therapy first; surgery (scalenectomy, first rib resection) if refractory

content.clinical_significance: 95% of TOS is neurogenic; diagnosis often challenging
content.statement: Neurogenic TOS Detailed is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Thoracic-Outlet that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Neurogenic TOS Detailed helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Neurogenic TOS Detailed include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Neurogenic TOS Detailed.

Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
